Herbal remedies: One way to treat a common cold without medicines is by using herbal remedies. There are many herbs that have been used for centuries to treat colds, such as ginger, garlic, and echinacea. These herbs have natural anti-inflammatory and immune-boosting properties that can help alleviate cold symptoms.

Honey and lemon: Honey and lemon are two natural remedies that can help soothe a sore throat and ease coughing. Honey has antibacterial properties and can help coat and protect the throat, while lemon has a natural cough suppressant and can help clear congestion.

Probiotics: Probiotics are live bacteria and yeasts that are beneficial for our health, particularly our gut. They can help boost the immune system and improve digestion, which can be helpful in treating a cold. Foods rich in probiotics include yogurt, kefir, sauerkraut, and kimchi.

Vitamin C: Vitamin C is an essential nutrient that helps boost the immune system and protect against infections. Foods rich in vitamin C include citrus fruits, strawberries, bell peppers, and broccoli. Taking a vitamin C supplement can also be helpful in treating a cold.

Rest and hydration: Getting enough rest and staying hydrated is crucial in treating a cold. Rest helps the body heal and recover, while hydration helps loosen congestion and keep the throat moist. Drinking plenty of water, herbal teas, and warm broths can help keep the body hydrated and alleviate cold symptoms.
